title: Under the sustainable sea(weeds): gimme Seaweed talks eco-friendly and organic snacks - FoodNavigator-USA.com
summary: Gimme Seaweed is a plant-based snack company that has partnered with Korean farmers to produce sustainable, organic, and non-GMO seaweed. The company's seaweed snacks are made with a regenerative crop that requires no fertilizer, pesticides, water, or land, and absorbs carbon dioxide. Gimme Seaweed is also focused on simplifying packaging and diversifying distribution channels to make its products more convenient for consumers.
product_or_process: Seaweed snacks and Grab & Go packaging
likely_naics_codes: ['311421 -  Seafood Product Preparation and Packaging', '445299 -  All Other Grocery Stores', '424410 -  Wholesalers of Food, Beverage, and Tobacco Products', '311999 -  All Other Food Manufacturing']
greenwashing: The article doesn't suggest any greenwashing practices, and the company appears genuinely focused on sustainability.

title: Wheat replacement: South Korea partners with local food brands to intensify rice flour NPD - FoodNavigator-Asia.com
summary: South Korea's Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs (MAFRA) has launched a national 'Rice Product Development Project' to address the country's rice surplus and wheat supply shortage. The project involves 15 major food and beverage companies developing 19 new rice-based products, including noodles, bread crumbs, ramen, and snacks. The project aims to increase rice consumption by introducing familiar food products made with rice flour, which can be produced more sustainably than wheat flour.
product_or_process: Rice-based noodles and bread crumbs for frying
likely_naics_codes: ['311111 - Grain and Oilseed Milling', '311821 - Snack Food Manufacturing', '311919 - Other Food Manufacturing', '445110 - Grocery Stores']
greenwashing: The project does not appear to be greenwashing as the focus is on genuine sustainable production and consumption of rice flour.
